creator: Sarah Perez
title: (No AI) Particle’s AI news app listens to podcasts for interesting clips so you you don’t have to
dc:creator: Sarah Perez
content: AI news app Particle can now pull in key moments from podcasts, letting readers instantly play short, relevant clips alongside related stories.
contentSnippet: AI news app Particle can now pull in key moments from podcasts, letting readers instantly play short, relevant clips alongside related stories.

creator: Lauren Forristal
title: (No AI) Spotify rolls out AI-powered  Prompted Playlists to the U.K. and other markets
dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
content: Spotify continues to test its AI-powered “Prompted Playlists” feature, now rolling out the tool to Premium subscribers in the U.K., Ireland, Australia, and Sweden.
contentSnippet: Spotify continues to test its AI-powered “Prompted Playlists” feature, now rolling out the tool to Premium subscribers in the U.K., Ireland, Australia, and Sweden.

title: (No AI) If Big Tech cared about fighting AI slop, it wouldn’t be drowning us in it
author: Jess Weatherbed
content:
![Photo collage of a pig eating digital slop out of a bucket.](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/05/STKS511_AI_SLOP_A.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Progress towards reliable deepfake labelling tech is sluggish, despite all the “help” from AI providers. | Image: Cath Virginia / The Verge, Getty Images

As 2025 drew to a close, Instagram head Adam Mosseri ended the year by doom-posting about AI. "Authenticity is becoming infinitely reproducible," [Mosseri lamented](https://www.theverge.com/news/851954/feed-is-dead). "Everything that made creators matter - the ability to be real, to connect, to have a voice that couldn't be faked - is now accessible to anyone with the right tools." But people, Mosseri insisted, still wanted "content that feels real." His proposed solution was finding a way to label real media. "Camera manufacturers will cryptographically sign images at capture, creating a chain of custody," he said. The result would be a trustworthy system for determining what's not AI.

The g …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/882956/ai-deepfake-detection-labels-c2pa-instagram-youtube)
contentSnippet:

But people, Mosseri insisted, still wanted "content that feels real." His proposed solution was finding a way to label real media. "Camera manufacturers will cryptographically sign images at capture, creating a chain of custody," he said. The result would be a trustworthy system for determining what's not AI.
The g …
Read the full story at The Verge.

"Everything that made creators matter - the ability to be real, to connect, to have a voice that couldn't be faked - is now accessible to anyone with the right tools." […]

title: (No AI) How many AIs does it take to read a PDF?
author: Josh Dzieza
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/PDFs-AI-still.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Image: Kristen Radtke / The Verge

Last November, the House Oversight Committee had just released 20,000 pages of documents from the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, and Luke Igel and some friends were clicking around, trying to follow the threads of conversation through garbled email threads and a PDF viewer that was, frankly, "gross." In the coming months, the Department of Justice would release its own batches of files, more than three million of them - again, all PDFs.

This was a problem. While the Department of Justice had run optical character recognition over the text, it was not very good, Igel said, rendering the files more or less unsearchable.

"There was no interface …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/882891/ai-pdf-parsing-failure)

title: (No AI) OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners
content: OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners to help enterprises move from AI pilots to production with secure, scalable agent deployments.
contentSnippet: OpenAI announces Frontier Alliance Partners to help enterprises move from AI pilots to production with secure, scalable agent deployments.

title: (No AI) Our First Proof submissions

title: (No AI) Gemini 3.1 Pro: A smarter model for your most complex tasks
content: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.

title: (No AI) A new way to express yourself: Gemini can now create music
content: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.
contentSnippet: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.

creator: Reece Rogers
title: (No AI) How to Hide Google’s AI Overviews From Your Search Results
dc:creator: Reece Rogers
content: You can avoid Google’s AI summaries in your search results by simply adjusting your query. Or just switch search engines altogether.
contentSnippet: You can avoid Google’s AI summaries in your search results by simply adjusting your query. Or just switch search engines altogether.

creator: Steven Levy
title: (No AI) AI Safety Meets the War Machine
dc:creator: Steven Levy
content: Anthropic doesn’t want its AI used in autonomous weapons or government surveillance. Those carve-outs could cost it a major military contract.
contentSnippet: Anthropic doesn’t want its AI used in autonomous weapons or government surveillance. Those carve-outs could cost it a major military contract.
